alert.note: Alert for Eastern Mogollon Rim; Western Mogollon Rim (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 29 at 1:54PM MST until March 30 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM TO 8 PM MST THURSDAY ABOVE 6000 FEET... * WHAT...A cold front will bring a period of steady snow to the region in the early morning hours Thursday, especially for a few hours after sunrise. Snow will become more showery later Thursday morning, before heavier showers develop again Thursday afternoon and Thursday evening. Snow levels will fall as low as 4500 feet through the day Thursday, but most accumulation will be above 6000 feet. Expect southwest winds gusting from 40 to 45 mph at times. * WHERE...Areas above 6000 feet near Doney Park, Flagstaff, Forest Lakes, Heber-Overgaard and Williams. * WHEN...From 5 AM to 8 PM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Travel could be very difficult at times. Hazardous conditions will especially impact driving conditions Thursday morning and again Thursday evening. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. Snow forecast from 5 AM Thursday to 8 PM Thursday: Doney Park 1 to 3 inches Flagstaff 3 to 5 inches Forest Lakes 3 to 5 inches Heber-Overgaard 0 to 1 inches Williams 1 to 3 inches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Mogollon Rim; Western Mogollon Rim
